As AI systems become more integral to business operations, we're facing fundamental challenges.1️⃣ Companies are increasingly hiring "red teams" whose sole job is to break their AI systems, identifying vulnerabilities before they reach production. This approach requires creative thinking that goes far beyond standard QA.2️⃣ Post-deployment testing is becoming as important as pre-release verification. For teams building or implementing AI systems: your testing strategy needs to evolve. What's your organization doing to adapt its testing approach for AI systems? I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

As AI systems become more integral to business operations, we're facing fundamental challenges.1️⃣ Companies are increasingly hiring "red teams" whose sole job is to break their AI systems, identifying vulnerabilities before they reach production. This approach requires creative thinking that goes far beyond standard QA.2️⃣ Post-deployment testing is becoming as important as pre-release verification. For teams building or implementing AI systems: your testing strategy needs to evolve. What's your organization doing to adapt its testing approach for AI systems? I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

As AI systems become more integral to business operations, we're facing fundamental challenges.1️⃣ Companies are increasingly hiring "red teams" whose sole job is to break their AI systems, identifying vulnerabilities before they reach production. This approach requires creative thinking that goes far beyond standard QA.2️⃣ Post-deployment testing is becoming as important as pre-release verification. For teams building or implementing AI systems: your testing strategy needs to evolve. What's your organization doing to adapt its testing approach for AI systems? I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

As AI systems become more integral to business operations, we're facing fundamental challenges.1️⃣ Companies are increasingly hiring "red teams" whose sole job is to break their AI systems, identifying vulnerabilities before they reach production. This approach requires creative thinking that goes far beyond standard QA.2️⃣ Post-deployment testing is becoming as important as pre-release verification. For teams building or implementing AI systems: your testing strategy needs to evolve. What's your organization doing to adapt its testing approach for AI systems? I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

Sharing that Ayush K and Replit CEO are BOTH wrong. Please don't listen to fools who clearly aren't using these tools. They are leaders who have forgotten how to get their hands dirty.1. AI is NOW coding and it's getting better. Soon 80-90% of software will be built with AI automatons. The only question is when.2. Code is a LANGUAGE to describe to a computer WHAT to do. Software development is not writing code. It's a way to describe to a computer what you want in their language. 3. The computers can now talk to us in OUR language. You still need software design skills (process, workflow, integration, UX, QA etc) but you won't need to code for most tasks. But you do need to know how to THINK.4. The AI companies are building the tools to do the above. They need people to do that - until they won't. Of course they are hiring. 5. You WILL still need to understand what happens in the sausage factory. Having fundamental skills in python, HTML, and SQL will be helpful in giving you MORE words to collaborate with your AI friends. Also, I don't recommend Replit. I created a POC with it and it's not amazing. Applied there last year and never got an interview. (Not bitter, just for transparency.) I built a POC for a training application and the way their UX works is VERY brittle and their code is very slow. They didn't even support an icon in a button until August of last year. I recommend real code instead of these inefficient complex wrappers.

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

Sharing that Ayush K and Replit CEO are BOTH wrong. Please don't listen to fools who clearly aren't using these tools. They are leaders who have forgotten how to get their hands dirty.1. AI is NOW coding and it's getting better. Soon 80-90% of software will be built with AI automatons. The only question is when.2. Code is a LANGUAGE to describe to a computer WHAT to do. Software development is not writing code. It's a way to describe to a computer what you want in their language. 3. The computers can now talk to us in OUR language. You still need software design skills (process, workflow, integration, UX, QA etc) but you won't need to code for most tasks. But you do need to know how to THINK.4. The AI companies are building the tools to do the above. They need people to do that - until they won't. Of course they are hiring. 5. You WILL still need to understand what happens in the sausage factory. Having fundamental skills in python, HTML, and SQL will be helpful in giving you MORE words to collaborate with your AI friends. Also, I don't recommend Replit. I created a POC with it and it's not amazing. Applied there last year and never got an interview. (Not bitter, just for transparency.) I built a POC for a training application and the way their UX works is VERY brittle and their code is very slow. They didn't even support an icon in a button until August of last year. I recommend real code instead of these inefficient complex wrappers.

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

Sharing that Ayush K and Replit CEO are BOTH wrong. Please don't listen to fools who clearly aren't using these tools. They are leaders who have forgotten how to get their hands dirty.1. AI is NOW coding and it's getting better. Soon 80-90% of software will be built with AI automatons. The only question is when.2. Code is a LANGUAGE to describe to a computer WHAT to do. Software development is not writing code. It's a way to describe to a computer what you want in their language. 3. The computers can now talk to us in OUR language. You still need software design skills (process, workflow, integration, UX, QA etc) but you won't need to code for most tasks. But you do need to know how to THINK.4. The AI companies are building the tools to do the above. They need people to do that - until they won't. Of course they are hiring. 5. You WILL still need to understand what happens in the sausage factory. Having fundamental skills in python, HTML, and SQL will be helpful in giving you MORE words to collaborate with your AI friends. Also, I don't recommend Replit. I created a POC with it and it's not amazing. Applied there last year and never got an interview. (Not bitter, just for transparency.) I built a POC for a training application and the way their UX works is VERY brittle and their code is very slow. They didn't even support an icon in a button until August of last year. I recommend real code instead of these inefficient complex wrappers.

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

Sharing that Ayush K and Replit CEO are BOTH wrong. Please don't listen to fools who clearly aren't using these tools. They are leaders who have forgotten how to get their hands dirty.1. AI is NOW coding and it's getting better. Soon 80-90% of software will be built with AI automatons. The only question is when.2. Code is a LANGUAGE to describe to a computer WHAT to do. Software development is not writing code. It's a way to describe to a computer what you want in their language. 3. The computers can now talk to us in OUR language. You still need software design skills (process, workflow, integration, UX, QA etc) but you won't need to code for most tasks. But you do need to know how to THINK.4. The AI companies are building the tools to do the above. They need people to do that - until they won't. Of course they are hiring. 5. You WILL still need to understand what happens in the sausage factory. Having fundamental skills in python, HTML, and SQL will be helpful in giving you MORE words to collaborate with your AI friends. Also, I don't recommend Replit. I created a POC with it and it's not amazing. Applied there last year and never got an interview. (Not bitter, just for transparency.) I built a POC for a training application and the way their UX works is VERY brittle and their code is very slow. They didn't even support an icon in a button until August of last year. I recommend real code instead of these inefficient complex wrappers.

As AI systems become more integral to business operations, we're facing fundamental challenges.1️⃣ Companies are increasingly hiring "red teams" whose sole job is to break their AI systems, identifying vulnerabilities before they reach production. This approach requires creative thinking that goes far beyond standard QA.2️⃣ Post-deployment testing is becoming as important as pre-release verification. For teams building or implementing AI systems: your testing strategy needs to evolve. What's your organization doing to adapt its testing approach for AI systems? I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

Sharing that Ayush K and Replit CEO are BOTH wrong. Please don't listen to fools who clearly aren't using these tools. They are leaders who have forgotten how to get their hands dirty.1. AI is NOW coding and it's getting better. Soon 80-90% of software will be built with AI automatons. The only question is when.2. Code is a LANGUAGE to describe to a computer WHAT to do. Software development is not writing code. It's a way to describe to a computer what you want in their language. 3. The computers can now talk to us in OUR language. You still need software design skills (process, workflow, integration, UX, QA etc) but you won't need to code for most tasks. But you do need to know how to THINK.4. The AI companies are building the tools to do the above. They need people to do that - until they won't. Of course they are hiring. 5. You WILL still need to understand what happens in the sausage factory. Having fundamental skills in python, HTML, and SQL will be helpful in giving you MORE words to collaborate with your AI friends. Also, I don't recommend Replit. I created a POC with it and it's not amazing. Applied there last year and never got an interview. (Not bitter, just for transparency.) I built a POC for a training application and the way their UX works is VERY brittle and their code is very slow. They didn't even support an icon in a button until August of last year. I recommend real code instead of these inefficient complex wrappers.

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

Sharing that Ayush K and Replit CEO are BOTH wrong. Please don't listen to fools who clearly aren't using these tools. They are leaders who have forgotten how to get their hands dirty.1. AI is NOW coding and it's getting better. Soon 80-90% of software will be built with AI automatons. The only question is when.2. Code is a LANGUAGE to describe to a computer WHAT to do. Software development is not writing code. It's a way to describe to a computer what you want in their language. 3. The computers can now talk to us in OUR language. You still need software design skills (process, workflow, integration, UX, QA etc) but you won't need to code for most tasks. But you do need to know how to THINK.4. The AI companies are building the tools to do the above. They need people to do that - until they won't. Of course they are hiring. 5. You WILL still need to understand what happens in the sausage factory. Having fundamental skills in python, HTML, and SQL will be helpful in giving you MORE words to collaborate with your AI friends. Also, I don't recommend Replit. I created a POC with it and it's not amazing. Applied there last year and never got an interview. (Not bitter, just for transparency.) I built a POC for a training application and the way their UX works is VERY brittle and their code is very slow. They didn't even support an icon in a button until August of last year. I recommend real code instead of these inefficient complex wrappers.

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

Sharing that Ayush K and Replit CEO are BOTH wrong. Please don't listen to fools who clearly aren't using these tools. They are leaders who have forgotten how to get their hands dirty.1. AI is NOW coding and it's getting better. Soon 80-90% of software will be built with AI automatons. The only question is when.2. Code is a LANGUAGE to describe to a computer WHAT to do. Software development is not writing code. It's a way to describe to a computer what you want in their language. 3. The computers can now talk to us in OUR language. You still need software design skills (process, workflow, integration, UX, QA etc) but you won't need to code for most tasks. But you do need to know how to THINK.4. The AI companies are building the tools to do the above. They need people to do that - until they won't. Of course they are hiring. 5. You WILL still need to understand what happens in the sausage factory. Having fundamental skills in python, HTML, and SQL will be helpful in giving you MORE words to collaborate with your AI friends. Also, I don't recommend Replit. I created a POC with it and it's not amazing. Applied there last year and never got an interview. (Not bitter, just for transparency.) I built a POC for a training application and the way their UX works is VERY brittle and their code is very slow. They didn't even support an icon in a button until August of last year. I recommend real code instead of these inefficient complex wrappers.

As AI systems become more integral to business operations, we're facing fundamental challenges.1️⃣ Companies are increasingly hiring "red teams" whose sole job is to break their AI systems, identifying vulnerabilities before they reach production. This approach requires creative thinking that goes far beyond standard QA.2️⃣ Post-deployment testing is becoming as important as pre-release verification. For teams building or implementing AI systems: your testing strategy needs to evolve. What's your organization doing to adapt its testing approach for AI systems? I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

Sharing that Ayush K and Replit CEO are BOTH wrong. Please don't listen to fools who clearly aren't using these tools. They are leaders who have forgotten how to get their hands dirty.1. AI is NOW coding and it's getting better. Soon 80-90% of software will be built with AI automatons. The only question is when.2. Code is a LANGUAGE to describe to a computer WHAT to do. Software development is not writing code. It's a way to describe to a computer what you want in their language. 3. The computers can now talk to us in OUR language. You still need software design skills (process, workflow, integration, UX, QA etc) but you won't need to code for most tasks. But you do need to know how to THINK.4. The AI companies are building the tools to do the above. They need people to do that - until they won't. Of course they are hiring. 5. You WILL still need to understand what happens in the sausage factory. Having fundamental skills in python, HTML, and SQL will be helpful in giving you MORE words to collaborate with your AI friends. Also, I don't recommend Replit. I created a POC with it and it's not amazing. Applied there last year and never got an interview. (Not bitter, just for transparency.) I built a POC for a training application and the way their UX works is VERY brittle and their code is very slow. They didn't even support an icon in a button until August of last year. I recommend real code instead of these inefficient complex wrappers.

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤

Username: María Daniela Acosta EspitiaMaría Daniela Acosta Espitia
Post Content:
¡We are hiring!CHEIL COLOMBIA is seeking our next talent for Quality Assurance (QA) Tester, which will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of a regional scale project focusing on WP. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide testing activities.2. Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.3. Identify, report, and track defects using bug tracking systems, providing detailed information to facilitate resolution by developers.4. Conduct regression testing to ensure that previously identified defects have been fixed and that new changes have not introduced unintended side effects.5. Perform exploratory testing to uncover hidden defects, usability issues, or areas for improvement that may not be covered by formal test cases.6. Test software across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers to ensure compatibility and consistency in different environments.7. Document test results, including test case execution logs, defect reports, and test coverage metrics, to provide stakeholders with accurate and timely feedback on product quality.8. Collaborate with developers, product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure alignment throughout the development lifecycle.9. Identify opportunities to improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies, proposing and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.10. Coordinate and support user acceptance testing activities, working closely with end-users to validate software against real-world usage scenarios and feedback. Qualifications: 1. Previous experience as a QA Tester or in a related quality assurance role, preferably in a software development environment.2. Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field; relevant certifications (ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.3. Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, including manual testing, automated testing, and defect tracking systems.4. Excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.5. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, sharing knowledge, providing feedback, and contributing to a positive and inclusive work culture.6. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and deadlines, while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality results.7. Ability to troubleshoot issues, investigate root causes, and propose practical solutions to improve software quality and performance.8. Handling and updating requests in JIRA9. Proficiency in Spanish and English (B2 certified) is a must.On-site job in Bogotá. Monday to Friday scheduleHow to apply?Send your CV to: d.espitia@cheil.com

Sharing that Ayush K and Replit CEO are BOTH wrong. Please don't listen to fools who clearly aren't using these tools. They are leaders who have forgotten how to get their hands dirty.1. AI is NOW coding and it's getting better. Soon 80-90% of software will be built with AI automatons. The only question is when.2. Code is a LANGUAGE to describe to a computer WHAT to do. Software development is not writing code. It's a way to describe to a computer what you want in their language. 3. The computers can now talk to us in OUR language. You still need software design skills (process, workflow, integration, UX, QA etc) but you won't need to code for most tasks. But you do need to know how to THINK.4. The AI companies are building the tools to do the above. They need people to do that - until they won't. Of course they are hiring. 5. You WILL still need to understand what happens in the sausage factory. Having fundamental skills in python, HTML, and SQL will be helpful in giving you MORE words to collaborate with your AI friends. Also, I don't recommend Replit. I created a POC with it and it's not amazing. Applied there last year and never got an interview. (Not bitter, just for transparency.) I built a POC for a training application and the way their UX works is VERY brittle and their code is very slow. They didn't even support an icon in a button until August of last year. I recommend real code instead of these inefficient complex wrappers.

I know the job market is feeling intimidating and overwhelming for so many in our space right now. With new tariffs coming through — we remain unsure of what’s to come. In some ways, the future feels as scary and unfamiliar as February/March 2020 — when we didn’t know what we would lose or what it would mean. The future is* brighter than it feels, but that doesn’t help right now. What does help is building connections, sharing and supporting hiring efforts, and being transparent about hiring and needs. Some of the things we are doing at Caxy: — We’ve consolidated our hiring down to the most active roles we are hiring for right now to help with how folks spend their energy. — We are also creating more space for new folks to enter our world with our annual internship program set to start in June (applications open in end of April/early May) for dev, data science, QA, PM, and UX roles. Some additional things I would love to help do: — If I have a connection you want, reach me and I’ll setup an intro. — if you need a recruiter or staffing connection, reach me. — if you want a 30 minute resume review- send them my way. I would love to help. — if you’re wanting some career space, I’m opening up my calendar for my annual mini-coaching. I have 12 spots open. — if you are open to work, I’ll repost your notes for visibility. — and finally — if you have skills you think Caxy could benefit from, let’s talk.Wishing you all the best. I’m here with you 🖤
